meanings.definition: Make a hissing sound when frying or cooking.
meanings.sent1: The bacon started to sizzle in the pan.
meanings.sent2: I love the sound of food sizzling on the grill.
meanings.sent3: The eggs began to sizzle in the hot butter, making a delightful noise.
meanings.sent4: The excitement in the kitchen sizzled as the chef prepared the dish.
meanings.sent5: The sizzle of the steak on the barbecue filled the backyard with a mouth-watering aroma.

meanings.definition: A hissing sound made when frying or cooking.
meanings.sent1: The loud sizzle of the frying pan caught my attention.
meanings.sent2: The delicious smell of sizzle wafted from the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The sizzle of the hot oil in the pan sounded like a tiny concert.
meanings.sent4: The sizzle of the stir-fry was music to my ears after a long day.
meanings.sent5: The sizzle of the bacon in the morning always wakes me up with a smile.

meanings.definition: To be very hot or to heat up quickly.
meanings.sent1: The summer sun made the pavement sizzle under our feet.
meanings.sent2: The excitement in the air sizzled as the event drew closer.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a surprise party sizzled in my mind all day.
meanings.sent4: His anger sizzled like a pot about to boil over.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the room sizzled as they waited for the results.
